optionalfeature.name: Acidic Nature
entries: The natural acidity of the swamp gives the swamp creature resistance to acid damage. If the creature already has resistance to acid damage, they gain immunity to acid damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Action: Crushing Grip
entries: The bird's powerful talons crush a creature they are grappling or attached to. The target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Action: Deafening Song (Recharge 6)
entries: The swarm produces an earsplitting buzz. Each creature within 15 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be deafened (save ends at end of turn).

optionalfeature.name: Action: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two Bite attacks. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Adept Climber (Bear)
entries: The bear has a climbing speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Adept Climber (Wildcat)

prerequisite.other: Clouded leopard, jaguar, leopard, lynx, or snow leopard

entries: The wildcat has a climbing speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aerial Pursuit (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the bird starts their turn in the air, they can triple their flying speed until the end of their turn. If they descend at least 30 feet on that turn, they have advantage on the next attack they make before the end of their turn. (Replaces the High-Speed Dive trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Agile Flyer
entries: While in the air, the bird has a +5 bonus to Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Landing
entries: The wildcat takes no damage from falling 40 feet or less, provided they aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Arctic Traveler
entries: The bear has advantage on saving throws to avoid gaining exhaustion, can tolerate temperatures as cold as −50° Fahrenheit, and ignores difficult terrain created by ice or snow.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Decay
entries: The tomb creature has resistance to necrotic damage, and immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Bonus Action: Fearsome Growl (1/Day)
entries: The bear lets out a mighty growl. Each creature within 15 feet of the bear who can hear them must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the bear until the end of the bear's next turn. A creature who succeeds on their saving throw is immune to the Fearsome Growl of all bears for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Burrower
entries: The swarm has a burrowing speed of 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Clever Claws
entries: The bear can use their long claws in place of thieves' tools to open locks, and they gain a +3 bonus to Dexterity checks made to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision

prerequisite.other: Beetles, mosquitoes, cockroaches, or any nocturnal insect

entries: The swarm has darkvision out to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Bite
entries: When the wildcat hits a {@condition prone} creature with a Bite attack, the attack is a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Decapitating Strike
entries: When the bird scores a critical hit against a Tiny target, the target is decapitated. A decapitated target dies if they can't survive without that head.

optionalfeature.name: Desert Dweller
entries: The wildcat ignores difficult terrain created by dirt and sand. They can tolerate temperatures as high as 120° Fahrenheit, and they don't need to drink water as long as they have fresh food.

optionalfeature.name: Disease Carrier
entries: When the swarm hits a creature with an attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} (save ends at end of turn).

optionalfeature.name: Durable
entries: The swarm's hit points are doubled, and they have an Armor Class of 15, a +5 bonus to Constitution saving throws, and advantage on Constitution saving throws. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Flyer

prerequisite.other: Cicadas, locusts, wasps, or any flying insect

entries: The swarm has a flying speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Fungal Infestation
entries: The underground creature is covered in layers of poisonous fungi. They have immunity to poison damage. The first time the underground creature takes damage on a turn, each creature within 5 feet of them takes {@damage PB} poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Glide
entries: The bird can take a short rest while flying horizontally.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Detritus
entries: {@recharge 5} The hag conjures magical seaweed and fish guts to restrain their foes. Each enemy in a 30-foot cone emanating from the hag must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of the hag's next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

optionalfeature.name: Hear the Unseen
entries: At the start of their turn, the cave creature can emit a subsonic trill (no action required). If they aren't {@condition deafened}, they can see their surroundings, including {@condition invisible} and hidden creatures within 200 feet of them who aren't behind total cover, until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Living Forest
entries: A writhing grove thrives in a 30-foot radius centered on the enchanted forest creature. Mist lightly obscures that area, and colorful vines and shifting foliage make its ground difficult terrain. Teasing voices laugh and whisper, giving other creatures in that area disadvantage on saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells and similar effects. Flickering lights extinguish magical darkness in that area created by spells of 3rd level or lower. (When adding this trait to a creature, you can choose to exclude one or more of these effects.)

optionalfeature.name: Low-Light Senses
entries: The sewer creature gains {@sense blindsight} or {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Dweller
entries: The wildcat ignores difficult terrain created by snow, ice, or steep slopes.

entries.name: Rending Teeth
entries: As a bonus action, you can grow your teeth into natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes for 1 minute. You can use Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of your teeth, which deal {@damage 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier piercing damage instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. The first time on a turn that you hit an enemy with this attack, you and your companion regain hit points equal to the damage dealt. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Ursine Might
entries: As a bonus action, you empower yourself with the strength of a great bear. For the next minute, your Strength-based attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d10} damage and you have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Oozomorphism
entries: As a bonus action, you become amorphous for 5 minutes, along with any gear you wear or carry. For the duration, you can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Desert Warrior
entries: You ignore difficult terrain created by dirt or sand, and you are considered naturally adapted to hot climates.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to activate an aura that shimmers around you like a desert mirage. For 1 minute, you and allies within 10 feet of you have a +PB bonus to Constitution saving throws and saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Riverkith
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can breathe lightning in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your exploit save DC, taking {@damage 6d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Crawling Menace
entries: You can use a bonus action to become as nimble on the ground as you are on your feet. For 1 hour, crawling doesn't cost you extra movement, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, being prone doesn't give other creatures advantage on attacks against you, and being {@condition prone} doesn't give you disadvantage on attacks. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Ear to the Ground
entries: As a bonus action, you gain {@sense tremorsense|MM} out to a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Flesh to Diamonds
entries: As a bonus action, you cover your skin with a hardened layer of crystals and gems that lasts for 10 minutes. For the duration, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Chaotic Form
entries: As a bonus action, you channel your companion's chaotic energy into yourself, constantly shifting your form and making you harder to hit. When you use this bonus action and at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, roll a {@dice d6}. Your AC increases by the number rolled until the start of your next turn. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Griffon-Hearted
entries: As an action, you can fly up to twice your walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks. During this movement, you can enter the spaces of other creatures and these spaces don't count as difficult terrain for you. The first time you enter each creature's space during this move, they must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your exploit save DC or take bludgeoning damage equal to your beastheart level and be knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Fissure Force
entries: As an action, you can send tremors through dirt, sand, or solid stone. The area within 30 feet of your current space becomes difficult terrain for enemies for 1 minute. For the duration, an enemy who starts their turn inside this area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your exploit save DC or be knocked prone. Once you use this action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Decimation of Magic
entries: As a bonus action, you tap into an innate magical resistance. For 1 minute, you have resistance to all damage dealt by spells and magical effects. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Unleash Sunlight
entries: As a bonus action, you cause your skin to flare with brilliant light. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you who can see you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your exploit save DC or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spined Skin
entries: As a bonus action, you cause your skin to sprout poisoned spines for 1 minute. For the duration, a creature who touches you or hits you with a melee attack takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage, and they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your exploit save DC or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Earthen Strength
entries: As a bonus action, your limbs grow dense and swing with incredible force for 1 minute. For the duration, when you hit a creature no more than one size category larger or smaller than you with a melee weapon attack, the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Vile Stench
entries: As a bonus action, you cause your body to expel toxins into the air. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you who needs to breathe must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your exploit save DC or be {@condition poisoned} and have their speed halved for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Fungicea
entries: You can use a bonus action to become as nimble on the ground as you are on your feet. For 1 hour, crawling doesn't cost you extra movement, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, being {@condition prone} doesn't give other creatures advantage on attacks against you, and being {@condition prone} doesn't give you disadvantage on attacks. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Maw of the Mound
entries: As a bonus action, you can bite an enemy as an unarmed strike. You can use Dexterity or Strength for the attack and damage rolls of this attack. On a hit, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Dexterity or Strength modifier piercing damage instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. You can make this attack a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Crafty Boogie
entries: As a bonus action, you create a diversion for another creature you can see. The creature can use a reaction to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Essence Drainer
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} damage. You regain hit points equal to the extra damage dealt. You can use deal this extra damage a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Stone Pereon
entries: As a bonus action, you manifest rugged metameres on your back that last 10 minutes. For the duration, you gain a +2 bonus to AC and you can't be {@condition flanked|FleeMortals}. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hunt from the Shadow
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill if you don't already have it, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using that skill.

entries.name: Acid-Enhanced
entries: As a bonus action, you cause your hands to exude acid for 1 minute. While exuding acid, your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal an extra {@damage 1d8} acid damage. Once you use this bonus action, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Night Hunter
entries: The bird has darkvision out to a range of 120 feet and has a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Noxious Vines
entries: {@recharge 5} Long toxic vines whip out from the hag. Each enemy within 30 feet of the hag must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each ally within 30 feet of the hag regains 18 ({@damage 4d8}) hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Ocean Hunter
entries: When the bird starts their turn above water, they don't have disadvantage on attacks due to being underwater until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Of Unusual Size
entries: If the sewer creature is Small or Tiny, their size increases to Medium and their Hit Dice type changes to a d8. This gives them 1 extra hit point per Hit Die if originally Small, or 2 extra hit points per Hit Die if originally Tiny.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Swamp
entries: The swamp creature has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive creatures within a swamp who don't have this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wildcat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wildcat's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@creature incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Phantoms Abound
entries: {@recharge 5} The hag fills the area around them with illusions of their enemies' worst fears. Each enemy within 30 feet of the hag must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage, falls {@condition prone}, and if the hag is within 5 feet of the target, the hag can make a Dream Claw attack against them. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage, doesn't fall {@condition prone}, and the hag doesn't attack them.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Impact
entries: If the bird descends at least 20 feet on their turn immediately before hitting with a Rending Talons attack or Talons attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. (+1 CR)

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Jaws
entries: The bear's Bite attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage, and it deals maximum damage to Plants. (A bear with this feature can't take the Multiattack action.)

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Leap

prerequisite.other: Caracal, cougar, lion, margay, serval, or snow leopard

entries: The wildcat's jump distance is doubled, with or without a running start. They can choose whether their Strength or Dexterity score determines their jump distance.

optionalfeature.name: Rockbreaker
entries: Chitinous claws or blades around the cave creature's limbs give them a burrowing speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Climber
entries: The ruined keep creature has a climbing speed equal to their walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Delver
entries: When the ruined keep creature is behind an object that grants them half cover, they are considered to have three-quarters cover instead.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Runner
entries: The ruined keep creature ignores difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Scavenger's Resilience
entries: The bird has advantage on Constitution saving throws and resistance to poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Blend
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the underground creature can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The enchanted forest creature can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

optionalfeature.name: Sprint (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

prerequisite.other: Black bear, brown bear (grizzly bear), polar bear, spectacled bear, or sun bear

entries: When the bear moves on their turn in combat, they can triple their speed until the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sting

prerequisite.other: Fire ants, bullet ants, or wasps

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or 1 piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage if the swarm has half their hit points or fewer. (Replaces the Bite attack)

optionalfeature.name: Superior Sprint (2/Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the wildcat moves on their turn in combat, they can quadruple their speed until the end of their turn. (Replaces the Sprint trait.)

optionalfeature.name: Swamp Stride
entries: The swamp creature ignores difficult terrain caused by the natural conditions of a swamp.

optionalfeature.name: Swimmer
entries: The wildcat has a swimming speed of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Rot
entries: When the tomb creature hits a target with a melee attack, the attack deals {@damage PB} extra necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once per turn, the enchanted forest creature can use 10 feet of their movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be the same size category as the enchanted forest creature or bigger.

optionalfeature.name: Tunnel-Adapted
entries: Without squeezing, the cave creature can move through spaces large enough for a creature one size smaller than them.

optionalfeature.name: Underground Senses
entries: The underground creature gains one of the following senses: {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 300 feet, {@sense tremorsense|MM} out to a range of 120 feet, or {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Hunger
entries: The tomb creature can perceive each creature within 30 feet of them who isn't a Construct or an Undead, as if the tomb creature had {@sense blindsight}.

optionalfeature.name: Used to Filth
entries: The sewer creature gains resistance to poison damage and immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition. If the creature already has resistance to poison damage, they gain immunity to poison damage instead.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Hover
entries: The bird can hover while flying.

item.name: Amethyst Die
entries: This gaming die is carved from a fragment of powerful psionic crystal and resonates with a remnant of its power. This die has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can expend 1 charge to roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll. Immediately after the ability check, attack roll, or saving throw is resolved, you take psychic damage equal to twice the number you rolled on the {@dice d6}.

item.name: Boog's Ball
entries: This magic stone sphere is incredibly dense, has a 3-inch radius, and grows when thrown. As an action, you can throw the ball at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. If you throw the ball 30 feet or less away from you, the ball grows to a 5-foot radius. If you throw the ball farther than 30 feet, it grows to a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the ball's area when it reaches that point must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage. The ball then shrinks back to its 3-inch radius and teleports either into your open hand or into a pack or pouch you wear (your choice).

item.name: Bracers of the Spellbreaker
entries: These mithral bracers are engraved with runes and inlaid with three multicolored bands of tiny gemstones.
While wearing these bracers, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. In addition, damage from your spell attacks ignore your target's damage resistances.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The bracers are a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Crown of Majesty
entries: This mithral circlet is inscribed with an intricate filigree formed of Elvish runes. The front of the circlet holds a flawless diamond that changes hue in sunlight.
While wearing this crown, you have resistance to psychic damage, and you can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

The crown has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 18): {@spell command} or {@spell charm person}. The crown regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The crown is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Eye of Sunrise
entries: A crimson gemstone glitters on the back of this black iron gauntlet. While wearing the gauntlet, you can use a bonus action to cause the stone to shed bright red light in a 10-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} for an additional 10 feet. You can use another bonus action to extinguish the light.

Additionally, you can use an action to raise the gauntlet and emit a fiery explosion in a 30-foot cone. The explosion can be heard 300 feet away. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} fire damage plus {@damage 5d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each structure and mundane object in the area that isn't being worn or carried takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage plus {@damage 10d6} force damage. Once this action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Iron Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use an action to speak a passphrase known only to the High Command of the Black Iron Pact—"Blood of Rioja"—and choose a target destination. If you are not in the demiplane known as the Cyst, you must choose a destination within the Cyst. If you are already in the Cyst, you must choose a destination you have visited before. Once you choose a destination in this way, the ring teleports you there. The ring can be used to teleport twice and regains both uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Once you attune to this ring, you can't take it off or end your attunement to it unless you are targeted by a {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power of 4th order or higher or the {@spell greater restoration} spell.

item.name: Mantle of the Lightbender
entries: This elegant cloak is lined with the iridescent mane of a {@creature lightbender|FleeMortals}. When you're hit with an attack while wearing this cloak, you can use your reaction to reveal that the attacker is attacking a past visual imprint of you. You appear in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of your imprint, the attack misses, then the imprint disappears. You can't use this reaction if the attacker relies on senses other than sight, such as {@sense blindsight}, or if they can perceive illusions as false, as with {@sense truesight}. Once you use the cloak to reveal a past visual imprint of yourself, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Mindrazor
entries: This rapier was forged using shattered fragments of a powerful psionic crystal and ore from a falling star. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This rapier has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to attempt to inflict a psionic wound. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw or become vulnerable to psychic damage for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

item.name: Pathfinder's Boots
entries: Silver eyelets decorate these soft leather boots. While wearing these boots, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC and your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

The boots have 7 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells from them: {@spell feather fall}, {@spell jump}, or {@spell shield}. The boots regain {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The boots are a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Pendant of Grave Regeneration
entries: While you wear this pendant, your skin becomes pale and cold to the touch, and you regain 5 hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Attuning to this pendant extends its curse to you. Until the curse is broken with a remove curse spell or similar magic, you can't take it off, and your creature type is Undead instead of your normal type.

item.name: Poison Popper
entries: You can throw this inedible fruit at a point you can see within 60 feet of you, causing it to explode and release a cloud of noxious gas in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. The cloud spreads around corners and lingers for 1 minute. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

The cloud's area is {@quickref Vision and Light||2||lightly obscured}, and when a creature enters it for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature's speed is halved. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

item.name: Ring of Scarlet Shadows
entries: This iridium ring is inlaid with an obsidian band. The stone inlay occasionally appears to writhe or shift, as if shadows play along its surface.

While wearing this ring, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet, or if you already have {@sense darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Shadow Blade
entries: You can use a bonus action to extend a blade of shadows from the hand that wears the ring. You can wield the blade as a shortsword that deals necrotic damage instead of piercing damage. While the blade is extended, you can't drop it or hold anything else in that hand. You can dismiss the blade as a bonus action.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The ring is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

entries.name: (Requires Attunement)
entries: This magic maul is made of a durable, light metal and has a long haft, giving it a reach of 10 feet. When you hit a creature with this maul, they are hexed until the end of their next turn. Whenever a creature hexed in this way makes an attack roll or saving throw, they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
While you hold the maul, you can use an action to change the appearance of its head, choosing its shape and color.

item.name: Sun Eater's Mind
entries: The shifting shadows within this black glass ring constantly move. While wearing this ring, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes a spell attack against you or casts a spell that requires you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to pierce the creature's mind. The next attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn is automatically a critical hit. The ring can be used to pierce a creature's mind three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Sun Eater's Gift
entries: While within 30 feet of a willing creature who is attuned to the Sun Eater's soul, you can use a bonus action to swap places with them. The ring can be used to swap places three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Sun Eater's Soul
entries: This black metal ring is unnervingly matte, reflecting nothing even in the brightest of light. While wearing this ring, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the damage that creature takes from the attack. The ring can be used to halve damage three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Sun Eater's Grace
entries: When you cast a spell that restores hit points to a creature, you can also restore that same number of hit points to a creature within 30 feet of you who is attuned to the Sun Eater's mind. The ring can be used to restore hit points three times and regains all uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Tome of the Ethereal
entries: Lighter than it rightly should be, this book is always cold to the touch and blurs when seen in periphery. While holding the tome, you can see into the Ethereal Plane out to a range of 120 feet.

In addition, the tome has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dusk. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you with a power, a spell, or an attack while you aren't on the Ethereal Plane, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and choose one of the following effects:

items: You enter the Ethereal Plane, then return to the plane and the space you left at the start of your next turn.

entries: If that space is occupied, you return to the nearest unoccupied space of your choice.

items: You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

item.name: Treant Arrow
entries: This arrow is carved from the boughs of a living {@creature treant|FleeMortals}.

When a creature takes damage from the arrow, they are {@condition restrained} by vines that sprout from the shaft. A creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check as an action, freeing themself or another creature {@condition restrained} by the arrow within their reach on a success.
Once a treant arrow restrains a creature or if the treant used to make the arrow dies, it becomes a mundane arrow.

item.name: Visionary's Cloak
entries: This gray, hooded traveler's cloak sports a white silk hem and a platinum clasp that, when closed, resembles the shape of an eye.
While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on initiative checks and can't be surprised.

Additionally, when you wear the cloak with the hood up, you gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet and your eyes cast a soft blue-white glow. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

entries.name: Cursed Sentience
entries: The cloak is a sentient and cursed magic item, as described {@book above|FleeMortals|3|Magic Items|4}.

item.name: Waning Moon
entries: This slender elven bow is lacquered blue and purple.
Its inside curve twinkles with tiny diamonds set like a field of stars.
This magical longbow grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. If you hit a creature who can't see you with this bow, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.
Additionally, when you hit a target with an attack made with the bow, you can choose to become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute and take the {@action Hide} action as part of the attack.
The invisibility ends early if you attack, cast a spell, or manifest a power. Once this invisibility has been used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

trait.name: Death Snap
entries: When the hyena is reduced to 0 hit points, they can deal {@damage 1} piercing damage to a creature within 5 feet of them (no action required), provided they weren't {@condition incapacitated} before dropping to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the hyena takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the hyena takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1} piercing damage. If the target is a creature and two or more hyenas joined the attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 plus the number of hyenas who joined the attack.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

action.name: Signature Attack (Bite)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Unbalancing Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The hyena makes a signature attack. On a hit, the target also has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity saving throw they make before the start of their next turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Gobbling Bite (5 Ferocity)
entries: The hyena makes a signature attack with advantage. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} necrotic damage, and the hyena regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: 5th Level: Cackle (8 Ferocity)
entries: Each enemy within 30 feet of the hyena who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 10 plus PB} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage PBd4} psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of the hyena until the start of the hyena's next turn.

reaction.name: Blood Frenzy (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the hyena's caregiver is hit with an attack and the hyena is within 5 feet of the attacker, the hyena can make a signature attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the spark takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the spark takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Wind Sweep (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 slashing damage, and if this attack was made by more than one air spark against a Large or smaller creature, the sparks can move that creature up to 5 feet horizontally for each spark that joined the attack.

monster.name: Ancient Lightning Eel

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eel can breathe air and water. They can survive out of water for up to 24 hours.

trait.name: Foudroyant Majesty (3/Day)
entries: When the eel fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead. When they do, they can't take the Multiattack action on their next turn.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The eel has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or end the {@condition grappled} condition on themself.

trait.name: Stormsurge
entries: Other lightning eels within 30 feet of the ancient eel deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage with their weapon attacks and Electric Pulse.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eel makes one Bite attack and uses Electric Pulse.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition restrained} and the eel can't make a Bite attack against another target.

action.name: Electric Pulse
entries: The eel channels energy toward a creature within 60 feet of them. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, made with disadvantage if the target is touching the eel. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.

bonus.name: Coiling Storm
entries: The eel coils around a creature within 5 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

reaction.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: When another lightning eel that the ancient eel can see within 30 feet of them is reduced to 0 hit points, the ancient eel releases a crackling filament of lightning in their direction. The target is restored to life with 10 hit points. Each lighting eel can be restored to life only once with this reaction.

legendaryHeader: The eel has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Call to the Storm
entries: Every other lightning eel within 30 feet of the ancient eel can use their Electric Pulse action as a reaction.

legendary.name: Action 2: Electric Rush
entries: The eel surges with lightning, moves up to their speed, then makes a Bite attack. On a hit, the Bite attack deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage. A creature who hits the eel with a melee attack during this movement takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Action 3: Fulminous Wave
entries: The eel releases a crackling wave of electricity and uses Electric Pulse against each enemy within 30 feet of them.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The blade can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: Opportunity attacks against the blade are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the blade with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the blade, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Machete
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Wild Hop
entries: The blade jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed. If the blade uses this bonus action to jump at least 10 feet straight toward a creature, the next Machete attack the blade makes against that creature on the same turn is made with advantage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The needler can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Sniper
entries: If the needler misses with a ranged weapon attack while they are hidden, they remain hidden. Additionally, if the needler makes a ranged weapon attack with advantage and hits, the attack deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the needler with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the needler, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of their turns.

bonus.name: Hop and Hide
entries: The needler jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed, then takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The seer can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Third Eye
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the seer can't hide from the seer. Creatures who can't be targeted by divination magic are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the seer with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the seer, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Acid Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. If the target is a creature and they attack the seer before the start of the seer's next turn, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Refulgent Beam
entries: The seer fires two magical beams of radiant energy, each beam targeting a creature the seer can see within 120 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage and shed dim light in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While shedding light in this way, attack rolls against the target have advantage, the target can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}, and they can't take the Hide action.

action.name: Noxious Bubble (1/Day)
entries: The seer creates a 5-foot-radius sphere filled with toxic gas in an unoccupied space they can see within 60 feet of them. If undisturbed, this bubble lasts for 1 minute then dissipates harmlessly. If a creature attacks the bubble, touches it, enters its space, or otherwise disturbs it, the bubble bursts, and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Psychedelic Drone (1/Day)
entries: Each enemy within 60 feet of the seer who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

bonus.name: Hop
entries: The seer jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The slink can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slink can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Toxiferous
entries: When a creature hits the slink with a melee attack while within 5 feet of them or touches the slink, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slink makes one Poison Dagger attack and one Tongue Nab attack.

action.name: Poison Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Tongue Nab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The slink grabs one Small or Tiny object the slink can see that the target is holding or carrying. The slink can catch the object if they have a free hand, otherwise it lands at the slink's feet.

bonus.name: Hop and Hide
entries: The slink jumps a number of feet up to their walking speed, then takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Acid Burst
entries: When the tadpole is reduced to 0 hit points, their body pops, spraying acid around them. Each creature within 5 feet of the tadpole takes 1 acid damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tadpole can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the tadpole takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the tadpole takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Noxious Skin
entries: When a creature starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more tadpoles, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. The DC for this saving throw equals 10 plus the number of tadpoles within 5 feet of the creature.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

hp.special: Seven times their level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The angulotl yegg can breathe air and water.

action.name: Signature Attack (Poison Knife)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 plus PB} piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Beginning at 7th level, the yegg can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Death from Above! (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the yegg jumps up to their walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If they leap over an enemy during this jump, the yegg can make a signature attack with advantage against that enemy. On a hit, this attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 5th Level: Lay Low (3/Day)
entries: When the yegg hits a creature with a signature attack while hidden, the yegg can use their reaction to remain hidden.

action.name: 7th Level: Excoriating Acid (3/Day)
entries: As an action, the yegg throws a flask of acid at a point they can see within 20 feet of them. The flask shatters, and each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage PBd10} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Ankheg

trait.name: Disoriented Resistance (2/Day)
entries: When the ankheg fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead, and they can't use bonus actions until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Earth Walk
entries: Difficult terrain composed of earth and stone doesn't cost the ankheg extra movement.

trait.name: Soft Underbelly
entries: When a {@condition prone} creature within 5 feet of the ankheg attacks the ahkheg, the attack is made with advantage instead of disadvantage.

trait.name: Unstable Tunneler
entries: While burrowing, the ankheg leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in their wake. Each section of tunnel collapses 1 minute after the ahkheg leaves that space.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the ankheg can't make a Bite attack against another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit {@recharge}
entries: The ankheg spits acid in a 30-foot long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage and is bathed in acid. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

A creature who is bathed in acid takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). A creature can use their action to wipe the acid off themself or another creature within their reach, ending the effect early.

bonus.name: Earth Eruption
entries: While burrowing within 10 feet of the surface, the ankheg erupts (without spending movement) into a 10-foot square on the ground directly above them. This area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature on the ground in this area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pushed 5 feet to an unoccupied space of the ankheg's choice and is {@condition restrained} by rubble. A creature can use their action to free themself or another creature within their reach. On a successful save, a creature is moved 5 feet to an unoccupied space of the creature's choice and is not {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Skitter
entries: When a creature attacks the ankheg, the ankheg can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendaryHeader: The ankheg has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The ankheg can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Big Bug!
entries: The ankheg stands on their hind legs in an impressive and terrifying display of dominance. Each enemy within 30 feet of the ankheg who can see them must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the ankheg for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

legendary.name: Action 2: Quick Burrow
entries: If the ankheg is {@condition grappled}, the condition ends for them, and they burrow up to twice their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If the ankheg is grappling a Large or smaller creature during this movement, the ankheg's speed is not halved.

legendary.name: Action 3: Acid Bath
entries: Acid sprays from the ankheg's wounds onto each creature within 15 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: Anthracia has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Anthracia makes three attacks using Stone Touch, Missile Thorn, or both. She can also use Tree Teleport, if available.

action.name: Stone Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (save ends at end of turn) as their limbs become heavy. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they become stable and are {@condition petrified} into a withered stone tree featuring their tortured likeness. The petrification lasts until the creature is restored by a {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power of 4th order or higher, a {@spell greater restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

action.name: Missile Thorn
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tree Teleport (3/Day; 5th-Level Spell)
entries: Anthracia touches a living tree. She instantly teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another living tree within 500 feet of the first.
Both trees must be Medium or larger.

action.name: Wall of Poison (1/Day)
entries: Anthracia conjures an opaque wall of poisonous gas centered on a point she can see within 150 feet of her. The wall can be up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall lingers in the air for 1 minute and its area is heavily obscured. Each creature who is in that area when the wall appears or who enters it for the first time on a turn must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 4d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who don't need to breathe automatically succeed on this saving throw. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the wall after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

reaction.name: Sudden Quake
entries: When an enemy moves within 15 feet of Anthracia, she creates a small tremor in the ground beneath her. Each creature within 15 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Antimagic Lethargy
entries: While in the area of an {@spell antimagic field} spell, the amalgam's speed is halved and they can't use reactions. Additionally, if targeted by the {@spell dispel magic} spell, the amalgam must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or be unable to use reactions for 1 minute.

trait.name: Arcane Tracker
entries: If the amalgam comes within 30 feet of a creature or object affected by magic, the amalgam can unerringly track that target for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Explosive Enhancement
entries: After the amalgam is hit with an attack using a mundane melee weapon, that weapon becomes charged with vibrating energy. For the next minute, the weapon gains a cumulative +1 bonus to damage rolls. If this bonus increases to +3, the weapon explodes and is destroyed, and the creature wielding it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the amalgam remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a puddle of muck.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The amalgam can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the amalgam can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The amalgam can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcane amalgam makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage if the amalgam has half their hit points or fewer.

action.name: Wild Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The unstable compounds that form the amalgam react violently to each other. Each creature within 10 feet of the amalgam must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage of a random type (roll a {@dice d6} for each creature): 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, force; 5, necrotic; 6, poison. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
entries: When the amalgam takes damage from a spell, they emit a burst of magical energy. Each creature within 10 feet of the amalgam must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage of the type dealt to the amalgam by the triggering spell. If the spell dealt more than one type of damage, the amalgam chooses which type this reaction deals.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Argan can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Argan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pervasive Magic
entries: Damage from Argan's spell attacks ignore the target's damage resistances.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Argan makes three Arcane Lance attacks.

action.name: Arcane Lance (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) force damage, and Argan moves the target up to 15 feet horizontally.

action.name: Lightning Volley (3rd-Level Spell)
entries: Argan calls down lightning on up to three creatures he can see within 30 feet of him. Each target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage and their speed is halved until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and their speed is not halved.

action.name: Fireball (1/Day; 7th-Level Spell)
entries: Argan sculpts a fiery explosion centered on a point within 90 feet of him. Each creature of his choice in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Misty Step (2/Day; 2nd-Level Spell)
entries: Argan teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Aronar can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Aronar has advantage on saving throws he makes to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on himself.

trait.name: Delusions of Grandeur
entries: Whenever Aronar is affected by an effect (such as the {@spell hold person} spell) that allows him to make a saving throw at the end of his turn, he can also repeat that saving throw at the start of his turn. Additionally, whenever Aronar succeeds on a saving throw against an effect, he ends that effect on himself and any ally within 30 feet of him under the same effect.

trait.name: Sun Eater's Grace (3/Day)
entries: When Aronar is within 30 feet of Athmia and casts a spell that restores hit points to another creature, Athmia regains the same number of hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aronar makes three Divine Mace attacks, or he makes one Divine Mace attack and one God Complex attack.

action.name: Divine Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: God Complex (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of Aronar's next turn has advantage.

action.name: Cure Wounds (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: Aronar touches a creature and the target regains 21 ({@dice 3d8 + 8}) hit points.

bonus.name: Vainglory (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: A creature of Aronar's choice within 60 feet of him regains 15 ({@dice 3d4 + 8}) hit points.

reaction.name: Sun Eater's Soul (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Aronar can see within 30 feet of him is hit with an attack, he can halve the attack's damage dealt to them.

monster.name: Ashen Hoarder
languages: understands the languages of their creator but can't speak

trait.name: Corpse Carrier
entries: The hoarder carries 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) corpses, which they can use with Corpse Bomb and Create Zombies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoarder makes two Arm attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, they can use Impale on the target.

action.name: Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (hoarder's choice).

action.name: Impale
entries: The hoarder attempts to impale one Larger or smaller creature they can see within 10 feet of them on their spikes. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns, and if this damage reduces them to 0 hit points, they die and become an additional corpse for the hoarder's Corpse Carrier. A creature can use their action to make a {@dc 17} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, and on a success, they free themself or a creature within reach who is {@condition restrained} by the hoarder. If the hoarder is destroyed, each creature {@condition restrained} by them is freed.

action.name: Corpse Bomb
entries: The hoarder hurls a corpse up to 60 feet, destroying it and releasing necrotic energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the corpse. Each creature in this area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of the hoarder's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't prevented from regaining hit points.

bonus.name: Create Zombies
entries: The hoarder drops any number of corpses from their Corpse Carrier. Each dropped corpse rises as a zombie in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the hoarder and takes their turn immediately after the hoarder's.

monster.name: Ashyra

trait.name: Atonement (3/Day)
entries: If Ashyra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she does, she must either end the effect of her Ancient Curse on one enemy within 120 feet of her or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the end of her next turn.

trait.name: Mummy Dust
entries: Whenever Ashyra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of her takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ashyra makes two attacks using Desiccating Slam, Soul Fire, or both, and she uses Ancient Curse.

action.name: Desiccating Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's speed is reduced to 0, and they can't regain hit points until the start of Ashyra's next turn.

action.name: Soul Fire (3rd-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) radiant damage, and if the target is a creature, their hit point maximum decreases by a number equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest or is targeted by a {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power of 4th order or higher, a {@spell greater restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect. The target dies if this effect reduces their hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Ancient Curse
entries: Ashyra inflicts weakness on one creature she can see within 120 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. While the target is cursed in this way, their attacks deal half damage. The curse lasts until Ashyra chooses to end it or until removed by a {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power, a {@spell remove curse} spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

bonus.name: Misty Step (2nd-Level Spell)
entries: Ashyra teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

reaction.name: Weight of Ages
entries: When a creature Ashyra can see within 60 feet of her deals damage to her, Ashyra brings down the weight of ages on them. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of their next turn.

legendaryHeader: Ashyra has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Sands of the Ancients
entries: A storm of stinging dirt whirls around Ashyra in a 15-foot-radius until the end of her next turn. For the duration, that area is heavily obscured, and when a creature starts their turn in or enters that area for the first time on a turn, they must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Action 2: Dust to Dust
entries: Ashyra bursts into a cloud of dust and makes one Desiccating Slam attack against each enemy within 60 feet of her, then she reforms in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of her original location.

legendary.name: Action 3: Last Rites
entries: Ashyra commands the land to entomb her foes. Each enemy within 30 feet of her must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and is entombed in stone. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and is not entombed. An entombed creature is {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the stone, and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage at the end of each of their turns. The creature can be freed if the stone is destroyed (AC 17; 30 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage).

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Athmia has advantage on saving throws she makes to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on herself.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Athmia is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Mental Assault (1/Turn)
entries: When Athmia hits a creature with her Soul Blade attack, she can assault their mind. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or expend one spell slot of the highest level available with no effect. A creature who fails this saving throw but can't expend a spell slot must instead spend 3 of their Hit Dice with no effect, or if they can't, take an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Athmia makes two Soul Blade attacks.

action.name: Soul Blade
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d6 + 8}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Athmia until the end of her next turn.

action.name: Psychic Frenzy (1/Day)
entries: Athmia clouds the minds of her foes.

Each enemy within 60 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of her next turn. Athmia gains 5 temporary hit points for each creature who fails this save.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Athmia takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Sun Eater's Gift (3/Day)
entries: While within 30 feet of Aronar, Athmia swaps places with him if he is willing.

reaction.name: Sun Eater's Mind (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Athmia can see within 60 feet of her makes a spell attack against her or casts a spell that requires her to make a saving throw, she can pierce their mind, and the next attack she makes against that creature is automatically a critical hit.

monster.name: Atæshia

trait.name: Offer to Remembrance (3/Day)
entries: When Atæshia fails a saving throw, a willing creature within 60 feet of her who can see her can give their life to protect her. This creature dies instantly, and Atæshia succeeds on the saving throw.

trait.name: Reborn From War
entries: When Atæshia is reduced to 0 hit points, she disintegrates into ash on a solemn wind. For the next 100 years, if a Celestial, a Elemental, or a Humanoid whose challenge rating or level is 5 or higher dies within 60 feet of where Atæshia died, Atæshia returns to life where she died with 25 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Atæshia makes three Pale Flame attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Moment of Loss, if available.

action.name: Pale Flame
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) radiant damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they die and all their remains burn to nothing.

action.name: Moment of Loss {@recharge}
entries: Atæshia transforms one creature she can see within 60 feet of her into the form of a living ash cloud. While transformed to ash, the target is immune to all damage, can't provide cover to other creatures, and can't take reactions. At the start of the target's next turn, they reform and must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is reduced to 1 hit point. On a successful save, the target takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage. This damage can't reduce the target's hit points below 1.

action.name: From Death, Life (1/Day)
entries: Atæshia uses her Kindled Sacrifice villain action, even if it is unavailable, to sacrifice herself.

bonus.name: Flickering Flame
entries: Atæshia forms into a cloud of ash, teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 60 feet of her, and reforms into her true form. Each creature within 5 feet of the space she left must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Convocation of Ash
entries: When another Elemental Atæshia can see within 60 feet of her is hit with an attack, the damage from the attack is halved and the target can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendaryHeader: Atæshia has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Wave of Sorrow
entries: Atæshia unleashes a pulse of overwhelming sadness. Each enemy Atæshia can see within 120 feet of her must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). On a successful save, a creature can't take reactions until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Action 2: Kindled Sacrifice
entries: Atæshia chooses a willing creature within 60 feet of her to die so their allies may live. The target dies, and up to two other dead creatures within 60 feet of the target return to life. These revived creatures regain the same number of hit points the sacrificed creature had, up to the revived creature's hit point maximum.

legendary.name: Action 3: Life's Finale
entries: Atæshia releases a torrent of primordial anguish to unmake the marrow of creation around her. Each enemy within 60 feet of her must make a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, they take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the end of Atæshia's next turn. On a successful save, they take half as much damage, but suffer no other effect. Succeed or fail, if this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they immediately fail one death saving throw.

monster.name: Aurumvas

trait.name: Abyssal Resistance (Costs 2 Souls)
entries: When Aurumvas fails a saving throw, he succeeds instead.

trait.name: Lethe
entries: When Aurumvas's soul count is 0, he has advantage on attack rolls, disadvantage on saving throws, and his Intelligence score becomes 3 (-4). Additionally, Aurumvas must use his movement on each of his turns to move as close as possible to the nearest creature he can sense with his soulsight, and then if he is able, he must use his action to attack and attempt to kill that creature. Aurumvas can't act with any other purpose until he adds 1 to his soul count.

trait.name: Soul Devourer
entries: When Aurumvas reduces a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead to 0 hit points or deals damage to a dying creature, the creature must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, Aurumvas consumes the creature's soul and adds 1 to his soul count. A creature whose soul is consumed in this way immediately dies, and they can't be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Soul Weapons
entries: While Aurumvas's soul count is 2 or higher, his weapon attacks are magical, and allies within 60 feet of him deal an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage with weapon attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aurumvas makes three attacks using Greedy Hands, Covetous Bolt, or both.

action.name: Greedy Hands
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. Aurumvas can burn 1 soul to gain temporary hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

action.name: Covetous Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage. If the target has spell slots, Aurumvas can burn 2 souls to force the target to expend their highest-level spell slot available with no effect.

bonus.name: Greed Is Good
entries: Aurumvas chooses an object he can see within 30 feet of him that is worth at least 100 gp. He teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that object.

reaction.name: Absorb Soul
entries: If a demon with a soul count of 1 or higher who Aurumvas can see dies within 60 feet of him, Aurumvas gains 1 soul.

legendaryHeader: Aurumvas has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Time Is Money
entries: Aurumvas warps time with his supernatural greed. Each ally he can see within 120 feet of him moves up to their speed. At the end of this round of combat, Aurumvas rearranges the initiative order in any way he chooses.

legendary.name: Action 2: That's Ours
entries: Aurumvas chooses up to three magic items he can see within 30 feet of him that aren't artifacts or of legendary rarity and that don't require attunement. He teleports each item to an ally who he can see within 30 feet of him, placing it either into their hands or at their feet. If a targeted object is being worn or carried by an enemy, the enemy can make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw, preventing that object from being teleported on a success.

legendary.name: Action 3: At Any Cost
entries: Aurumvas teleports Tiny explosive treasures from his vault to four different points he can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature within 10 feet of one or more of these points must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Baron Uthrak

trait.name: Bloodstones (3 Uses)
entries: When Baron Uthrak fails a saving throw while holding his magic longsword Nine Lives, he can choose to succeed instead. If he does so, he takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage as one of the bloodstones set in the sword's pommel fills with his blood.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Baron Uthrak makes an attack, he has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Baron Uthrak makes two attacks using Nine Lives, Whip, or both.

action.name: Nine Lives
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward Baron Uthrak.

bonus.name: Kneel, Peasant!
entries: Baron Uthrak kicks a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature Baron Uthrak can see misses him with a melee attack, Baron Uthrak makes a melee attack against that creature.

legendaryHeader: Baron Uthrak has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Shoot!
entries: Each ally within 60 feet of Baron Uthrak who can hear him can make a ranged weapon attack (no action required).

legendary.name: Action 2: Form Up!
entries: Baron Uthrak and each ally within 60 feet of him who can hear him can move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Baron Uthrak and each ally enters a defensive stance that lasts until that creature moves or is {@condition restrained} or {@condition incapacitated}. When two or more allies in a defensive stance are within 5 feet of each other, attack rolls against them are made with disadvantage.

legendary.name: Action 3: Lead from the Front
entries: Baron Uthrak moves up to twice his speed without provoking opportunity attacks. During or after this movement, he can make up to four Nine Lives or Whip attacks with advantage, each against a different target. After he attacks a target in this way, each ally within 5 feet of that target can make a melee attack with advantage against the same target (no action required).

resist.note: from mundane attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, the giant is indistinguishable from a statue.

trait.name: Stone Flesh
entries: When a creature attacks the giant with a melee weapon that isn't adamantine and rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for that attack, that weapon is destroyed if it is mundane. If that weapon is supernatural, it loses all supernatural properties for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Rune-Signed Blade attacks. They can replace one attack with a Forked Knives attack.

action.name: Rune-Signed Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, each time they are hit by this attack, their movement speed is reduced by a cumulative 10 feet (to a minimum speed of 5 feet) until they regain at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Forked Knives
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature on the ground, they are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} as they are pinned by the knife.
